SEARCH
Module com.example.rubankfx
Package com.example.rubankfx

Class Account

java.lang.Object
com.example.rubankfx.Account
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Account>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Checking, Savings
public abstract class Account extends Object implements Comparable<Account>
Represents an abstract account with basic functionalities. This class provides a foundation for different types of bank accounts. Subclasses should provide implementations for monthly interest and monthly fee calculations.
Author:
Arun Felix, Digvijay Singh

    • withdraw

      public void withdraw(double amount)
      Attempts to withdraw a specified amount from the account. If the account has insufficient funds, the withdrawal will not be processed.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to be withdrawn from the account.

    • getHelperMessage

      public String getHelperMessage()
      Retrieves the helper message which provides information about the last operation performed by the account, such as the outcome of a withdrawal attempt.
      Returns:
      The helper message containing the details of the last operation's outcome.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Account otherAccount)
      Compares this account to another account. This method should be implemented to define the ordering among accounts, e.g., based on holder's name or balance.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Account>
      Parameters:
      otherAccount - The other account to compare with.
      Returns:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this account is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified account.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks whether this account is equal to another object.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to check equality with.
      Returns:
      true if the objects are the same or represent the same account, false otherwise.

    • updateBalance

      public void updateBalance()
      Updates the account balance by applying monthly fees and interest rates. This should be called to reflect the monthly changes in the balance.

    • typecheck

      public Boolean typecheck(Account A, Account B)
      Checks if the types of two accounts are considered equivalent for certain operations. For example, a Checking account may be considered equivalent to a College Checking account.
      Parameters:
      A - the first account to compare.
      B - the second account to compare.
      Returns:
      true if the types are equivalent, false otherwise.
